DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate whether addition whey protein breakfast high fat content influence acute metabolic appetite response , well responses subsequent lunch meal .
DOC.brief_title: Metabolic Appetite Parameters Following Addition Whey Protein Fat-based Breakfast
DOC.detailed_description: Participants ask report lab first main trial , eat 12 hour , refrain caffeine alcohol intake strenuous exercise 24 hour . Both trial take place time day . Upon arrival height body mass record cannula insert vein back hand 10 ml blood sample taken.A visual analogue scale ( VAS ) use subjectively measure participant 's appetite pre-breakfast . Participants provide one two breakfast meal test randomised order . The two breakfast consist high fat breakfast high fat plus additional whey protein . A drink water shall also consume , volume depend trial carry . The high fat breakfast consist scramble egg yolk make single cream butter ( Tesco , Hertfordshire , UK ) . The macronutrient distribution breakfast 12 % protein , 3 % carbohydrate , 85 % fat ( 1771 kJ ; 423 kcal total ) . For whey protein trial , 23.9g whey protein isolate ( Lacprodan DI-9224 , Arla Foods , Denmark ) shall add water incorporate meal drink side , order provide 20g whey protein . A timer shall set participant take first mouthful breakfast , require rest follow 3 hour . At 15 , 30 , 45 , 60 , 90 , 120 , 150 180 minute post-breakfast 10 ml blood sample shall collect . Every 30 minute period appetite VAS also complete . After participant provide standardised lunch meal shall consist pasta tomato basil sauce , olive oil cheddar cheese , along 350 ml drink water . The macronutrient distribution lunch 13 % protein , 49 % carbohydrate , 38 % fat . Following , post-breakfast procedure shall repeat another period 3 hour .
DOC.criteria: Aged 1840 year old ( male ) Recreationally active ( > 30 minute structure exercise , 5 times/week ) Metabolic disease ( e.g . Type 2 diabetes , thyroid disorder ) Taking prescribed medication Regular breakfast skipper Food allergy intolerances Eating disorder Smoker
